00226 /* Function used for debugging */
00227 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_SHELL
00228 void print_nfs_res( nfs_res_t * p_res )
00229 {
00230   int index;
00231   for ( index = 0; index < sizeof(nfs_res_t); index++ )
00232   {
00233     if ( (index+1)%32 == 0 )
00234       printf("%02X\n",((char*)p_res)[index]);
00235     else
00236       printf("%02X.",((char*)p_res)[index]);
00237   }
00238   printf("\n");
00239 }
00240 #endif

00242 /* --------------- INTERNAL FH3 REPRESENTATION ---------------- */
00243 /* used for keeping handle value after
00244  * freeing nfs res.
00245  */
00246 typedef struct shell_fh3__
00247 {
00248   u_int data_len;
00249   char  data_val[NFS3_FHSIZE];
00250 } shell_fh3_t;
00251 
00252 static void set_shell_fh3( shell_fh3_t * p_int_fh3, nfs_fh3 * p_nfshdl)
00253 {
00254   p_int_fh3->data_len = p_nfshdl->data.data_len;
00255   memcpy( p_int_fh3->data_val, p_nfshdl->data.data_val, p_nfshdl->data.data_len );
00256 } 
00257 
00258 static void set_nfs_fh3( nfs_fh3 * p_nfshdl, shell_fh3_t * p_int_fh3 )
00259 {
00260   p_nfshdl->data.data_len = p_int_fh3->data_len ;
00261   p_nfshdl->data.data_val = p_int_fh3->data_val;
00262 } 
00263 /* ------------------------- END ------------------------------ */

00283 /* thread specific variables */
00284 
00285 typedef struct cmdnfs_thr_info__
00286 {
00287 
00288   int is_thread_init;
00289 
00290   /* export context : on for each thread,
00291    * on order to make it possible for them
00292    * to access different filesets.
00293    */
00294   fsal_export_context_t exp_context;
00295 
00297   fsal_op_context_t context ;
00298 
00299   /* AuthUnix_params for this thread */
00300   struct authunix_parms authunix_struct;
00301 
00303   cache_inode_client_t client ;
00304   cache_content_client_t dc_client ;
00305   
00306   
00307   /* info for advanced commands (pwd, ls, cd, ...) */
00308   int is_mounted_path;
00309   
00310   shell_fh3_t mounted_path_hdl;
00311   char mounted_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
00312       
00313   shell_fh3_t current_path_hdl;
00314   char current_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
00315   
00316 } cmdnfs_thr_info_t;
00317 
00318 
00319 /* pthread key to manage thread specific configuration */
00320 
00321 static pthread_key_t  thread_key ;
00322 static pthread_once_t once_key = PTHREAD_ONCE_INIT ;
00323 
00324 
00325 /* init pthtread_key for current thread */
00326 
00327 static void init_keys( void )
00328 {
00329   if( pthread_key_create( &thread_key, NULL ) == -1 )
00330     printf( "Error %d creating pthread key for thread %p : %s\n",
00331         errno,(caddr_t)pthread_self(),strerror(errno) ) ;
00332   
00333   return ;
00334 } /* init_keys */
00335 
00336 
00337 
00338 
00339 
00340 
00341 cmdnfs_thr_info_t * GetNFSClient()
00342 {
00343   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info ;
00344   
00345   /* first, we init the keys if this is the first time */
00346   if( pthread_once( &once_key, init_keys ) != 0 ){
00347     printf( "Error %d calling pthread_once for thread %p : %s\n",
00348         errno,(caddr_t)pthread_self(),strerror(errno) ) ;
00349     return NULL;
00350   }
00351   
00352   p_thr_info = (cmdnfs_thr_info_t *)pthread_getspecific( thread_key );
00353   
00354   /* we allocate the thread context if this is the first time */
00355   if (p_thr_info==NULL){
00356       
00357     /* allocates thread structure */
00358     p_thr_info = (cmdnfs_thr_info_t *)Mem_Alloc(sizeof(cmdnfs_thr_info_t));
00359     
00360     /* panic !!! */
00361     if (p_thr_info == NULL) {
00362       printf( "%p:commands_NFS: Not enough memory\n",(caddr_t)pthread_self());
00363       return NULL;
00364     }
00365     
00366     /* Clean thread context */
00367         
00368     memset(  p_thr_info, 0, sizeof( cmdnfs_thr_info_t ) );
00369     
00370     p_thr_info->is_thread_init = FALSE;
00371     p_thr_info->is_mounted_path = FALSE;
00372 
00373     /* set the specific value */
00374     pthread_setspecific( thread_key , (void *)p_thr_info ) ;
00375     
00376   }
00377  
00378   return p_thr_info ;
00379   
00380   
00381 } /* GetNFSClient */
00382 
00383 
00384 int InitNFSClient( cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info )
00385 {
00386   uid_t uid;
00387   fsal_status_t st;
00388   struct passwd * pw_struct;
00389   
00390   if ( p_thr_info == NULL ) return -1;
00391   
00392   if ( p_thr_info->is_thread_init == TRUE ) return 0;
00393   
00394   /* for the moment, create export context for root fileset */
00395   st = FSAL_BuildExportContext( &p_thr_info->exp_context,NULL, NULL );
00396     
00397   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00398   {    
00399     printf( "%p:commands_NFS: Error %d initing credentials for thread (FSAL_InitThreadCred)\n",
00400         (caddr_t)pthread_self(),st.major);
00401     return st.major;
00402   }
00403   
00404   /* initialize FSAL credential for this thread */
00405 
00406   st = FSAL_InitClientContext( &p_thr_info->context );
00407     
00408   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00409   {    
00410     printf( "%p:commands_NFS: Error %d initing credentials for thread (FSAL_InitThreadCred)\n",
00411         (caddr_t)pthread_self(),st.major);
00412     return st.major;
00413   }
00414 
00415   uid = getuid();
00416   pw_struct = getpwuid(uid);
00417   
00418   if ( pw_struct == NULL )
00419   {
00420     printf( "commands_NFS: Unknown user %u\n", uid );
00421     return errno;
00422   }
00423   
00424   st = FSAL_GetClientContext( &p_thr_info->context, &p_thr_info->exp_context,
00425                               uid, pw_struct->pw_gid, NULL , 0 );
00426 
00427   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00428     {
00429       printf( "%p:commands_NFS: Error %d getting contexte for uid %d (FSAL_GetUserCred)\n",
00430         (caddr_t)pthread_self(),st.major,uid);
00431       return st.major;
00432     }
00433   
00434   p_thr_info->authunix_struct.aup_machname = localmachine;
00435   p_thr_info->authunix_struct.aup_uid = uid;
00436   p_thr_info->authunix_struct.aup_gid = getgid();
00437   p_thr_info->authunix_struct.aup_len = 0; 
00439   /* Init the cache_inode client */
00440   if( cache_inode_client_init( &p_thr_info->client, cache_client_param, 0, NULL ) != 0 )
00441     return 1 ;
00442   
00443   /* Init the cache content client */
00444   if( cache_content_client_init( &p_thr_info->dc_client, datacache_client_param ) != 0 )
00445     return 1  ;
00446 
00447   p_thr_info->client.pcontent_client = (caddr_t)&p_thr_info->dc_client ;
00448     
00449   p_thr_info->is_thread_init = TRUE;
00450   
00451   return 0;
00452   
00453 } /* InitNFSClient */

00460   /* Nothing to do. */
00461   return;

00465 
00466 static void getopt_init()
00467 {
00468   /* disables getopt error message */
00469   Opterr = 0;   
00470   /* reinits getopt processing */
00471   Optind = 1;  
00472 }
00473 
00474 int nfs_init(char * filename,
00475              int flag_v,
00476              FILE * output
00477     )
00478 {
00479   config_file_t config_file;
00480   int rc;
00481   
00482   nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param.nb_prealloc_entry           = 100 ;
00483   nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param.flush_force_fsal            = 1 ;
00484   nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param.max_fd_per_thread           = 20 ;
00485   nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param.use_cache                   = 0 ;
00486   nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param.retention                   = 60 ;
00487   strcpy( nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param.cache_dir, "/tmp/ganesha.datacache" ) ;
00488         
00489   /* Parse config file */
00490       
00491   config_file = config_ParseFile( filename );
00492   
00493   if ( !config_file ){
00494     fprintf(output, "nfs_init: Error parsing %s: %s\n", filename,  config_GetErrorMsg());
00495     return -1;
00496   }
00497 
00498   if( ( rc = cache_content_read_conf_client_parameter( config_file, &nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param ) )!= CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00499   {
00500     fprintf( output, "nfs_init: Error %d reading cache content parameters.\n", -rc );
00501     return -1 ;
00502   }
00503   
00504           
00505   /* Read export list from file */
00506     
00507   rc = ReadExports( config_file, &pexportlist );
00508     
00509   if ( rc < 0 )
00510   {
00511     fprintf( output, "nfs_init: Error %d while parsing exports file.\n", -rc );
00512     return -1 ;
00513   }
00514   
00515   /* initalize export entries */
00516   if( rc = nfs_export_create_root_entry( pexportlist, ht ) != TRUE )
00517   {
00518       fprintf( output, "nfs_init: Error %d while initing root entries, exiting...", -rc );
00519       return -1 ;
00520   }  
00521   
00522   /* geting the hostname */
00523   rc = gethostname( localmachine, sizeof( localmachine ) );
00524   if( rc != 0 )
00525   {
00526     fprintf( output, "nfs_init: Error %d while getting hostname.\n", rc );
00527     return -1 ;
00528   }
00529 
00530     
00533   is_nfs_layer_initialized = TRUE;
00534   
00535   if (flag_v) fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer successfully initialized.\n" );
00536 
00537   return 0;
00538 }
00539 
00541 int fn_nfs_init( int argc ,          /* IN : number of args in argv */
00542                      char ** argv ,  /* IN : arg list               */
00543                      FILE * output   /* IN : output stream          */
00544          )
00545 {
00546   int flag_v   = 0;
00547   int flag_h   = 0;  
00548   int err_flag = 0 ;
00549   int option ;
00550   char * filename = NULL;
00551   int rc;
00552 
00553   static char format[]="hv";
00554 
00555   
00556   static char help_nfs_init[]=
00557 /*  "usage: nfs_init [options] <ganesha_config_file>\n"*/
00558   "usage: nfs_init [options] <ganesha_config_file>\n"
00559   "options :\n"
00560   "\t-h print this help\n"
00561   "\t-v verbose mode\n";
00562 
00563   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != FALSE )
00564   {
00565     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer is already initialized.\n" ) ;
00566     return 0 ;
00567   }
00568   
00569   /* analysing options */
00570   getopt_init();
00571   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
00572     {   
00573       switch( option )
00574         {
00575         case 'v':
00576           if( flag_v )
00577             fprintf( output,
00578                     "nfs_init: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n"); 
00579           else 
00580             flag_v++;
00581           break;
00582           
00583         case 'h':
00584           if( flag_h )
00585             fprintf( output,
00586                      "nfs_init: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n") ;
00587           else 
00588             flag_h++;
00589           break;
00590           
00591       case '?':
00592         fprintf( output, "nfs_init: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt ) ;
00593         err_flag ++;
00594         break;
00595         } /* switch */   
00596     } /* while */
00597   
00598   if( flag_h )
00599     {
00600       fprintf( output, help_nfs_init );
00601       return 0;
00602     }
00603 
00604   /* verifies mandatory argument */
00605   if( Optind != ( argc -1 ) )
00606     {
00607       /* too much or not enough arguments */
00608       err_flag ++;
00609     }
00610   else 
00611     filename = argv[Optind];
00612   
00613   if( err_flag )
00614     {
00615       fprintf(output,help_nfs_init);
00616       return -1;
00617     }
00618 
00619   rc = nfs_init(filename, flag_v, output);
00620   
00621   return rc;  
00622   
00623 } /* fn_nfs_init */
00624 
00625 
00626 
00628 int fn_MNT1_command( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00629                      char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00630                      FILE * output     /* IN : output stream          */
00631                     )
00632 {
00633 
00634   cmdnfs_funcdesc_t * funcdesc = mnt1_funcdesc;
00635   
00636   nfs_arg_t nfs_arg;
00637   nfs_res_t nfs_res;
00638   struct svc_req req;
00639   int rc;
00640   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
00641       
00642   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
00643   {
00644     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
00645     return -1 ;    
00646   }
00647   
00648   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
00649   
00650   if ( p_thr_info->is_thread_init != TRUE )
00651   {
00652     if ( rc = InitNFSClient( p_thr_info ) )
00653     {
00654       fprintf( output, "\t%s: Error %d during thread initialization.\n",argv[0],rc );
00655       return -1 ;
00656     }
00657   }
00658   
00659   while ( funcdesc->func_name != NULL )
00660   {
00661     if ( !strcmp(  funcdesc->func_name, argv[0] ) )
00662     {
00663       
00664       /* encoding args */
00665       
00666       if ( funcdesc->func_encode( CMDNFS_ENCODE,
00667                                   argc - 1, argv + 1,
00668                                   0, NULL,
00669                                   (caddr_t)&nfs_arg ) == FALSE )
00670       {
00671         fprintf(output,"%s: bad arguments.\n",argv[0]);
00672         fprintf(output,"Usage: %s\n",funcdesc->func_help);
00673         return -1;
00674       }
00675       
00676       /* preparing request identifier */
00677       req.rq_prog = MOUNTPROG;
00678       req.rq_vers = MOUNT_V1;
00679       
00680       req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
00681       
00682       /* nfs call */
00683       
00684       rc = funcdesc->func_call(
00685                                   &nfs_arg,
00686                                   pexportlist,
00687                                   &(p_thr_info->context),
00688                                   &(p_thr_info->client),
00689                                   ht,
00690                                   &req,
00691                                   &nfs_res
00692                                );
00693       
00694       /* freeing args */
00695       
00696       funcdesc->func_encode( CMDNFS_FREE,
00697                              0,NULL,0,NULL,
00698                              (caddr_t)&nfs_arg );
00699 
00700       /* decoding output */
00701       
00702 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_SHELL
00703       printf("MNTv1: RETURNED STRUCTURE:\n");
00704       print_nfs_res( &nfs_res );
00705 #endif
00706       
00707       funcdesc->func_decode( CMDNFS_DECODE,
00708                              0,NULL,0,output,
00709                              (caddr_t)&nfs_res );
00710       
00711       funcdesc->func_free( &nfs_res );
00712       
00713       /* returning status */
00714       return rc;
00715       
00716     }
00717     
00718     /* pointer to the next cmdnfs_funcdesc_t */
00719     funcdesc ++ ;
00720   }
00721   
00722   fprintf(output,"%s: command not found in MNT1 protocol.\n",argv[0]);
00723   return -1;
00724            
00725 } /* fn_MNT1_command */
00726

00730 
00732 int fn_MNT3_command( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00733                      char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00734                      FILE * output     /* IN : output stream          */
00735          ){
00736          
00737   cmdnfs_funcdesc_t * funcdesc = mnt3_funcdesc;
00738   
00739   nfs_arg_t nfs_arg;
00740   nfs_res_t nfs_res;
00741   struct svc_req req;
00742   int rc;
00743   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
00744       
00745   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
00746   {
00747     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
00748     return -1 ;    
00749   }
00750   
00751   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
00752   
00753   if ( p_thr_info->is_thread_init != TRUE )
00754   {
00755     if ( rc = InitNFSClient( p_thr_info ) )
00756     {
00757       fprintf( output, "\t%s: Error %d during thread initialization.\n",argv[0],rc );
00758       return -1 ;
00759     }
00760   }
00761   
00762   while ( funcdesc->func_name != NULL )
00763   {
00764     if ( !strcmp(  funcdesc->func_name, argv[0] ) )
00765     {
00766       
00767       /* encoding args */
00768       
00769       if ( funcdesc->func_encode( CMDNFS_ENCODE,
00770                                   argc - 1, argv + 1,
00771                                   0, NULL,
00772                                   (caddr_t)&nfs_arg ) == FALSE )
00773       {
00774         fprintf(output,"%s: bad arguments.\n",argv[0]);
00775         fprintf(output,"Usage: %s\n",funcdesc->func_help);
00776         return -1;
00777       }
00778       
00779       /* preparing request identifier */
00780       req.rq_prog = MOUNTPROG;
00781       req.rq_vers = MOUNT_V3;
00782       
00783       req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
00784       
00785       /* nfs call */
00786       
00787       rc = funcdesc->func_call(
00788                                   &nfs_arg,
00789                                   pexportlist,
00790                                   &(p_thr_info->context),
00791                                   &(p_thr_info->client),
00792                                   ht,
00793                                   &req,
00794                                   &nfs_res
00795                                );
00796       
00797       /* freeing args */
00798       
00799       funcdesc->func_encode( CMDNFS_FREE,
00800                              0,NULL,0,NULL,
00801                              (caddr_t)&nfs_arg );
00802 
00803       /* decoding output */
00804 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_SHELL
00805       printf("MNTv3: RETURNED STRUCTURE:\n");
00806       print_nfs_res( &nfs_res );
00807 #endif
00808       
00809       funcdesc->func_decode( CMDNFS_DECODE,
00810                              0,NULL,0,output,
00811                              (caddr_t)&nfs_res );
00812       
00813       funcdesc->func_free( &nfs_res );
00814 
00815       /* returning status */
00816       return rc;
00817       
00818     }
00819     
00820     /* pointer to the next cmdnfs_funcdesc_t */
00821     funcdesc ++ ;
00822   }
00823   
00824   fprintf(output,"%s: command not found in MNT3 protocol.\n",argv[0]);
00825   return -1;
00826          
00827 }
00828 
00829 
00830 
00831 
00833 int fn_NFS2_command( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00834                      char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00835                      FILE * output     /* IN : output stream          */
00836          )
00837 {
00838   
00839   cmdnfs_funcdesc_t * funcdesc = nfs2_funcdesc;
00840   
00841   nfs_arg_t nfs_arg;
00842   nfs_res_t nfs_res;
00843   struct svc_req req;
00844   int rc;
00845   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
00846 
00847   short           exportid;
00848   exportlist_t  * pexport;
00849       
00850   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
00851   {
00852     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
00853     return -1 ;    
00854   }
00855   
00856   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
00857   
00858   if ( p_thr_info->is_thread_init != TRUE )
00859   {
00860     if ( rc = InitNFSClient( p_thr_info ) )
00861     {
00862       fprintf( output, "\t%s: Error %d during thread initialization.\n",argv[0],rc );
00863       return -1 ;
00864     }
00865   }
00866   
00867   while ( funcdesc->func_name != NULL )
00868   {
00869     if ( !strcmp(  funcdesc->func_name, argv[0] ) )
00870     {
00871       
00872       /* encoding args */
00873       
00874       if ( funcdesc->func_encode( CMDNFS_ENCODE,
00875                                   argc - 1, argv + 1,
00876                                   0, NULL,
00877                                   (caddr_t)&nfs_arg ) == FALSE )
00878       {
00879         fprintf(output,"%s: bad arguments.\n",argv[0]);
00880         fprintf(output,"Usage: %s\n",funcdesc->func_help);
00881         return -1;
00882       }
00883       
00884       /* preparing request identifier */
00885       
00886       req.rq_prog = NFS_PROGRAM;
00887       req.rq_vers = NFS_V2;      
00888       req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
00889       
00890       /* the only function that doesn't take a filehandle */
00891       if ( funcdesc->func_call != nfs_Null )
00892       {
00893         exportid = nfs2_FhandleToExportId( ( fhandle2 *)&nfs_arg ) ;
00894         if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
00895         {
00896           /* invalid handle */
00897           fprintf( output, "\t%s: Bad arguments: Invalid file handle.\n",argv[0] );
00898           return -1 ;
00899         }
00900       }
00901       else
00902         pexport = NULL;
00903       
00904       
00905       /* nfs call */
00906       
00907       rc = funcdesc->func_call(
00908                                   &nfs_arg,
00909                                   pexport,
00910                                   &(p_thr_info->context),
00911                                   &(p_thr_info->client),
00912                                   ht,
00913                                   &req,
00914                                   &nfs_res
00915                                );
00916       
00917       /* freeing args */
00918       
00919       funcdesc->func_encode( CMDNFS_FREE,
00920                              0,NULL,0,NULL,
00921                              (caddr_t)&nfs_arg );
00922       
00923 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_SHELL
00924       printf("NFSv2: RETURNED STRUCTURE:\n");
00925       print_nfs_res( &nfs_res );
00926 #endif
00927                 
00928       /* decoding output */
00929       
00930       funcdesc->func_decode( CMDNFS_DECODE,
00931                              0,NULL,0,output,
00932                              (caddr_t)&nfs_res );
00933       
00934       funcdesc->func_free( &nfs_res );
00935 
00936       /* returning status */
00937       return rc;
00938       
00939     }
00940     
00941     /* pointer to the next cmdnfs_funcdesc_t */
00942     funcdesc ++ ;
00943   }
00944   
00945   fprintf(output,"%s: command not found in NFS2 protocol.\n",argv[0]);
00946   return -1;
00947          
00948 }
00949 
00950 
00952 int fn_NFS3_command( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00953                      char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00954                      FILE * output     /* IN : output stream          */
00955          )
00956 {
00957   
00958   cmdnfs_funcdesc_t * funcdesc = nfs3_funcdesc;
00959   
00960   nfs_arg_t nfs_arg;
00961   nfs_res_t nfs_res;
00962   struct svc_req req;
00963   int rc;
00964   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
00965 
00966   short           exportid;
00967   exportlist_t  * pexport;
00968       
00969   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
00970   {
00971     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
00972     return -1 ;    
00973   }
00974   
00975   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
00976   
00977   if ( p_thr_info->is_thread_init != TRUE )
00978   {
00979     if ( rc = InitNFSClient( p_thr_info ) )
00980     {
00981       fprintf( output, "\t%s: Error %d during thread initialization.\n",argv[0],rc );
00982       return -1 ;
00983     }
00984   }
00985   
00986   while ( funcdesc->func_name != NULL )
00987   {
00988     if ( !strcmp(  funcdesc->func_name, argv[0] ) )
00989     {
00990       
00991       /* encoding args */
00992       
00993       if ( funcdesc->func_encode( CMDNFS_ENCODE,
00994                                   argc - 1, argv + 1,
00995                                   0, NULL,
00996                                   (caddr_t)&nfs_arg ) == FALSE )
00997       {
00998         fprintf(output,"%s: bad arguments.\n",argv[0]);
00999         fprintf(output,"Usage: %s\n",funcdesc->func_help);
01000         return -1;
01001       }
01002       
01003       /* preparing request identifier */
01004       
01005       req.rq_prog = NFS_PROGRAM;
01006       req.rq_vers = NFS_V3;      
01007       req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
01008       
01009       /* the only function that doesn't take a filehandle */
01010       if ( funcdesc->func_call != nfs_Null )
01011       {
01012         exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( ( nfs_fh3 *)&nfs_arg ) ;
01013         if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
01014         {
01015           /* invalid handle */
01016           fprintf( output, "\t%s: Bad arguments: Invalid file handle.\n",argv[0] );
01017           return -1 ;
01018         }
01019       }
01020       else
01021         pexport = NULL;
01022       
01023       
01024       /* nfs call */
01025       
01026       rc = funcdesc->func_call(
01027                                   &nfs_arg,
01028                                   pexport,
01029                                   &(p_thr_info->context),
01030                                   &(p_thr_info->client),
01031                                   ht,
01032                                   &req,
01033                                   &nfs_res
01034                                );
01035       
01036       /* freeing args */
01037       
01038       funcdesc->func_encode( CMDNFS_FREE,
01039                              0,NULL,0,NULL,
01040                              (caddr_t)&nfs_arg );
01041       
01042 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_SHELL
01043       printf("NFSv3: RETURNED STRUCTURE:\n");
01044       print_nfs_res( &nfs_res );
01045 #endif
01046                 
01047       /* decoding output */
01048       
01049       funcdesc->func_decode( CMDNFS_DECODE,
01050                              0,NULL,0,output,
01051                              (caddr_t)&nfs_res );
01052       
01053       funcdesc->func_free( &nfs_res );
01054 
01055       /* returning status */
01056       return rc;
01057       
01058     }
01059     
01060     /* pointer to the next cmdnfs_funcdesc_t */
01061     funcdesc ++ ;
01062   }
01063   
01064   fprintf(output,"%s: command not found in NFS3 protocol.\n",argv[0]);
01065   return -1;
01066          
01067 } /* fn_NFS3_command */
01068 
01069 
01070 /*------------------------------------------------------------
01071  *     Wrapping of NFS calls (used by high level commands)
01072  *-----------------------------------------------------------*/
01073 
01074 
01075 /* solves a relative or aboslute path */
01076 static int nfs_solvepath(cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info,
01077                          char * io_global_path,    /* global path */
01078                          int size_global_path,/* max size for global path */
01079                          char * i_spec_path,  /* specified path */
01080                          shell_fh3_t * p_current_hdl, /* current directory handle */
01081                          shell_fh3_t * pnew_hdl,  /* pointer to solved handle */
01082                          FILE * output)
01083 {
01084   char str_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
01085   char * pstr_path = str_path;
01086   
01087   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN] ;
01088   char * next_name ;
01089   char * curr ;
01090   int last=0;
01091   int rc;
01092 
01093   shell_fh3_t hdl_lookup ;
01094   nfs_fh3 hdl_param ;
01095   
01096   diropargs3  dirop_arg;
01097   LOOKUP3res  lookup_res;
01098   struct svc_req req;
01099   short           exportid;
01100   exportlist_t  * pexport;
01101   
01102   strncpy(str_path, i_spec_path ,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);  
01103   curr = str_path;
01104   next_name = str_path;
01105 
01106   if (str_path[0] == '@')
01107     {
01108       
01109     rc = cmdnfs_fhandle3(
01110       CMDNFS_ENCODE, 1, &pstr_path,
01111       0,   NULL,
01112       (caddr_t)&hdl_param );
01113         
01114     if ( rc != TRUE )
01115     {
01116       fprintf( output, "Invalid FileHandle: %s\n",str_path );
01117       return -1;
01118     }
01119     
01120     strncpy( io_global_path, str_path ,size_global_path);
01121     
01122     set_shell_fh3( pnew_hdl , &hdl_param );
01123 
01124     cmdnfs_fhandle3( CMDNFS_FREE, 0, NULL, 0,   NULL,
01125                     (caddr_t)&hdl_param );    
01126     
01127     return 0;        
01128     
01129     }
01130   else if (str_path[0] == '/')
01131     {
01132       /* absolute path, starting from "/", with a relative path */
01133       curr ++;
01134       next_name ++;
01135       hdl_lookup =  p_thr_info->mounted_path_hdl ;
01136       strncpy(tmp_path, "/" ,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
01137 
01138       /* the the directory  is /, return */
01139       if (str_path[1]=='\0')
01140         {
01141           strncpy(io_global_path,tmp_path,size_global_path);
01142           *pnew_hdl = hdl_lookup ;
01143           return 0;
01144         }
01145       
01146     } 
01147   else 
01148     {
01149       hdl_lookup = *p_current_hdl ;
01150       strncpy(tmp_path, io_global_path ,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);  
01151     }
01152 
01153   /* Now, the path is a relative path, proceed a step by step lookup */
01154   do 
01155     {
01156       /* tokenize to the next '/' */         
01157       while( ( curr[0] != '\0' ) &&  
01158              ( curr[0] != '/' ) )
01159         curr++;
01160       
01161       if (!curr[0]) 
01162         last=1; /* remembers if it was the last dir */
01163       
01164       curr[0]='\0';
01165       
01166       /* build the arguments */
01167       
01168       set_nfs_fh3( &dirop_arg.dir, &hdl_lookup);
01169       dirop_arg.name = next_name;
01170       
01171       /* preparing request identifier */
01172       
01173       req.rq_prog = NFS_PROGRAM;
01174       req.rq_vers = NFS_V3;      
01175       req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;                  
01176       
01177       exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId(  &dirop_arg.dir ) ;
01178       if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
01179       {
01180         /* invalid handle */
01181         fprintf( output, "\tBad arguments: Invalid file handle.\n" );
01182         return -1 ;
01183       }
01184         
01185       /* lookup this name */
01186       
01187       rc = nfs_Lookup(
01188                         (nfs_arg_t*)&dirop_arg,
01189                         pexport,
01190                         &(p_thr_info->context),
01191                         &(p_thr_info->client),
01192                         ht,
01193                         &req,
01194                         (nfs_res_t*)&lookup_res
01195                      );
01196      
01197        if ( rc != 0 )
01198        {
01199          fprintf(output,"Error %d in nfs_Lookup.\n",rc);
01200          return rc;
01201        }
01202 
01203        rc = lookup_res.status;
01204        if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01205        {
01206          nfs3_Lookup_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&lookup_res );
01207          fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01208              rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01209          return rc;
01210        }
01211       
01212       /* updates current handle */
01213       set_shell_fh3( &hdl_lookup, &lookup_res.LOOKUP3res_u.resok.object ) ;
01214 
01215       nfs3_Lookup_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&lookup_res );
01216          
01217       /* adds /name at the end of the path */
01218       strncat(tmp_path,"/",FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01219       strncat(tmp_path,next_name,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01220 
01221       /* updates cursors */
01222       if( !last )
01223       {
01224         curr ++;
01225         next_name = curr ;
01226         /* ignore successive slashes */
01227         while((curr[0]!='\0') && (curr[0]=='/')){
01228           curr++;
01229           next_name = curr;
01230         }
01231         if (!curr[0]) last=1; /* it is the last dir */
01232       }
01233     
01234     } while( !last );
01235     
01236   /* everything is OK, apply changes */
01237   clean_path(tmp_path,size_global_path);
01238   strncpy(io_global_path,tmp_path,size_global_path);
01239     
01240   *pnew_hdl = hdl_lookup ;
01241   return 0;
01242  
01243 } /* nfs_solvepath */
01244 
01245 
01246 static int nfs_getattr( cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info, shell_fh3_t * p_hdl,
01247                         fattr3 * attrs, FILE * output )
01248 {
01249   GETATTR3res res;
01250   struct svc_req req;
01251   unsigned short exportid;
01252   exportlist_t  * pexport;
01253   int rc;
01254   
01255   nfs_fh3 nfshdl;
01256   
01257   /* preparing request identifier */
01258 
01259   req.rq_prog = NFS_PROGRAM;
01260   req.rq_vers = NFS_V3;      
01261   req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
01262 
01263   set_nfs_fh3( &nfshdl , p_hdl );
01264   
01265   exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( &nfshdl ) ;
01266   if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
01267   {
01268     /* invalid handle */
01269     fprintf( output, "\tBad arguments: Invalid file handle.\n" );
01270     return -1 ;
01271   }
01272   
01273   rc = nfs_Getattr(
01274                     (nfs_arg_t*)&nfshdl,
01275                     pexport,
01276                     &(p_thr_info->context),
01277                     &(p_thr_info->client),
01278                     ht,
01279                     &req,
01280                     (nfs_res_t*)&res
01281                  );
01282 
01283    if ( rc != 0 )
01284    {
01285      fprintf(output,"Error %d in nfs_Getattr.\n",rc);
01286      return rc;
01287    }
01288 
01289    rc = res.status;
01290    if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01291    {
01292      fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01293          rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01294      
01295      nfs_Getattr_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01296      return rc;
01297    }
01298 
01299   /* updates current handle */
01300   *attrs = res.GETATTR3res_u.resok.obj_attributes;
01301 
01302   nfs_Getattr_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01303   
01304   return 0;
01305   
01306 }
01307 
01308 
01309 static int nfs_access( cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info, shell_fh3_t * p_hdl,
01310                        nfs3_uint32 * access_mask, /* IN/OUT */
01311                        FILE * output )
01312 {
01313   ACCESS3args arg;
01314   ACCESS3res  res ;
01315   struct svc_req req;
01316   unsigned short exportid;
01317   exportlist_t  * pexport;
01318   int rc;
01319   
01320   /* preparing args */
01321   set_nfs_fh3( &arg.object, p_hdl);
01322   arg.access = *access_mask;
01323   
01324   /* preparing request identifier */
01325 
01326   req.rq_prog = NFS_PROGRAM;
01327   req.rq_vers = NFS_V3;      
01328   req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
01329 
01330   exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( &arg.object ) ;
01331   if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
01332   {
01333     /* invalid handle */
01334     fprintf( output, "\tBad arguments: Invalid file handle.\n" );
01335     return -1 ;
01336   }
01337   
01338   rc = nfs3_Access(
01339                     (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
01340                     pexport,
01341                     &(p_thr_info->context),
01342                     &(p_thr_info->client),
01343                     ht,
01344                     &req,
01345                     (nfs_res_t*)&res
01346                  );
01347 
01348    if ( rc != 0 )
01349    {
01350      fprintf(output,"Error %d in nfs_Access.\n",rc);
01351      return rc;
01352    }
01353 
01354    rc = res.status;
01355    if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01356    {
01357      fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01358          rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01359      nfs3_Access_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01360      return rc;
01361    }
01362 
01363   /* updates access mask */
01364   *access_mask = res.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access;
01365 
01366   nfs3_Access_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01367   
01368   return 0;
01369   
01370 }
01371     
01372 
01373 static int nfs_readlink( cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info, shell_fh3_t * p_hdl,
01374                          char * linkcontent, FILE * output )
01375 {
01376   READLINK3res res;
01377   struct svc_req req;
01378   unsigned short exportid;
01379   exportlist_t  * pexport;
01380   int rc;
01381   
01382   nfs_fh3 nfshdl;
01383   
01384   set_nfs_fh3( &nfshdl, p_hdl );
01385   
01386   /* preparing request identifier */
01387 
01388   req.rq_prog = NFS_PROGRAM;
01389   req.rq_vers = NFS_V3;      
01390   req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
01391 
01392   exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( &nfshdl ) ;
01393   if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
01394   {
01395     /* invalid handle */
01396     fprintf( output, "\tBad arguments: Invalid file handle.\n" );
01397     return -1 ;
01398   }
01399   
01400   rc = nfs_Readlink(
01401                     (nfs_arg_t*)&nfshdl,
01402                     pexport,
01403                     &(p_thr_info->context),
01404                     &(p_thr_info->client),
01405                     ht,
01406                     &req,
01407                     (nfs_res_t*)&res
01408                  );
01409 
01410    if ( rc != 0 )
01411    {
01412      fprintf(output,"Error %d in nfs_Readlink.\n",rc);
01413      return rc;
01414    }
01415 
01416    rc = res.status;
01417    if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01418    {
01419      fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01420          rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01421      nfs3_Readlink_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01422      return rc;
01423    }
01424 
01425   /* copy link content */
01426   strcpy( linkcontent, res.READLINK3res_u.resok.data );
01427   
01428   nfs3_Readlink_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01429   
01430   return 0;
01431   
01432 } /* nfs_readlink */
01433 
01434 
01435 
01436 static int nfs_readdirplus( cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info,
01437                          shell_fh3_t * p_dir_hdl,
01438                          cookie3 cookie,    
01439                          cookieverf3 * p_cookieverf, /* IN/OUT */
01440                          dirlistplus3 * dirlist,
01441                          nfs_res_t ** to_be_freed,
01442                          FILE * output )
01443 {
01444   READDIRPLUS3args arg;
01445   READDIRPLUS3res * p_res;
01446   struct svc_req req;
01447   unsigned short exportid;
01448   exportlist_t  * pexport;
01449   int rc;
01450 
01451   *to_be_freed = NULL;
01452     
01453   /* args */
01454   set_nfs_fh3( &arg.dir, p_dir_hdl );
01455   arg.cookie = cookie;
01456   memcpy ( &arg.cookieverf, p_cookieverf, sizeof( cookieverf3 ) );
01457   arg.dircount = 1024;
01458   arg.maxcount = 4096;
01459   
01460   /* preparing request identifier */
01461 
01462   req.rq_prog = NFS_PROGRAM;
01463   req.rq_vers = NFS_V3;      
01464   req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
01465 
01466   exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( &arg.dir ) ;
01467   if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
01468   {
01469     /* invalid handle */
01470     fprintf( output, "\tBad arguments: Invalid file handle.\n" );
01471     return -1 ;
01472   }
01473 
01474   p_res = ( READDIRPLUS3res * ) Mem_Alloc( sizeof( READDIRPLUS3res ) );
01475 
01476     
01477   rc = nfs3_Readdirplus(
01478                     (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
01479                     pexport,
01480                     &(p_thr_info->context),
01481                     &(p_thr_info->client),
01482                     ht,
01483                     &req,
01484                     (nfs_res_t*)p_res
01485                  );
01486 
01487    if ( rc != 0 )
01488    {
01489      Mem_Free( p_res );
01490      fprintf(output,"Error %d in nfs3_Readdirplus.\n",rc);
01491      return rc;
01492    }
01493 
01494    rc = p_res->status;
01495    if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01496    {
01497      nfs3_Readdirplus_Free( (nfs_res_t*)p_res );
01498      Mem_Free( p_res );
01499      fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01500          rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01501      return rc;
01502    }
01503   
01504    memcpy( p_cookieverf, p_res->READDIRPLUS3res_u.resok.cookieverf,
01505        sizeof( cookieverf3 ) );
01506    
01507    *dirlist = p_res->READDIRPLUS3res_u.resok.reply;
01508    *to_be_freed = (nfs_res_t*)p_res;
01509    
01510   return 0;
01511   
01512 } /* nfs_readdirplus */
01513 
01514 
01515 void nfs_readdirplus_free( nfs_res_t * to_free )
01516 {
01517   if ( to_free == NULL ) return;
01518   
01519   nfs3_Readdirplus_Free( (nfs_res_t*)to_free );
01520   Mem_Free( to_free );  
01521 }
01522 
01523 
01524 
01525 static int nfs_create( cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info,
01526                         shell_fh3_t * p_dir_hdl, char * obj_name,
01527                         mode_t posix_mode, shell_fh3_t * p_obj_hdl,
01528                         FILE * output )
01529 {
01530   CREATE3args arg;
01531   CREATE3res res;
01532   struct svc_req req;
01533   unsigned short exportid;
01534   exportlist_t  * pexport;
01535   int rc;
01536       
01537       
01538   /* preparing arguments */
01539   
01540   set_nfs_fh3( &arg.where.dir, p_dir_hdl );  
01541   arg.where.name = obj_name;
01542   arg.how.mode = GUARDED;
01543 
01544   /* preparing request identifier */
01545 
01546   req.rq_prog = NFS_PROGRAM;
01547   req.rq_vers = NFS_V3;      
01548   req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
01549 
01550   exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( &arg.where.dir ) ;
01551   if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
01552   {
01553     /* invalid handle */
01554     fprintf( output, "\tBad arguments: Invalid file handle.\n" );
01555     return -1 ;
01556   }
01557 
01558     
01559   /* empty sattr3 list */
01560   if ( cmdnfs_sattr3( CMDNFS_ENCODE, 0, NULL, 0, NULL,
01561                  (caddr_t)&(arg.how.createhow3_u.obj_attributes) ) == FALSE )
01562   {
01563     /* invalid handle */
01564     fprintf( output, "\tError encoding nfs arguments.\n" );
01565     return -1 ;
01566   }
01567   
01568   /* only setting mode */
01569   arg.how.createhow3_u.obj_attributes.mode.set_it = TRUE;
01570   arg.how.createhow3_u.obj_attributes.mode.set_mode3_u.mode = posix_mode;
01571   
01572   rc = nfs_Create(
01573                     (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
01574                     pexport,
01575                     &(p_thr_info->context),
01576                     &(p_thr_info->client),
01577                     ht,
01578                     &req,
01579                     (nfs_res_t*)&res
01580                  );
01581 
01582    if ( rc != 0 )
01583    {
01584      fprintf(output,"Error %d in nfs_Create.\n",rc);
01585      return rc;
01586    }
01587 
01588    rc = res.status;
01589    if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01590    {
01591      fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01592          rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01593      nfs_Create_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01594      return rc;
01595    }
01596 
01597   /* object handle */
01598   if ( res.CREATE3res_u.resok.obj.handle_follows )
01599     set_shell_fh3( p_obj_hdl, &res.CREATE3res_u.resok.obj.post_op_fh3_u.handle );
01600   else
01601     fprintf(output,"Warning: nfs_Create did not return file handle.\n");
01602     
01603   nfs_Create_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01604    
01605   return 0;
01606   
01607 }
01608 
01609 
01610 static int nfs_mkdir( cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info,
01611                         shell_fh3_t * p_dir_hdl, char * obj_name,
01612                         mode_t posix_mode, shell_fh3_t * p_obj_hdl,
01613                         FILE * output )
01614 {
01615   MKDIR3args arg;
01616   MKDIR3res res;
01617   struct svc_req req;
01618   unsigned short exportid;
01619   exportlist_t  * pexport;
01620   int rc;
01621   
01622   /* preparing request identifier */
01623 
01624   req.rq_prog = NFS_PROGRAM;
01625   req.rq_vers = NFS_V3;      
01626   req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
01627 
01628   /* preparing arguments */
01629   
01630   set_nfs_fh3( &arg.where.dir , p_dir_hdl );
01631   arg.where.name = obj_name;
01632 
01633   exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( &arg.where.dir ) ;
01634   if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
01635   {
01636     /* invalid handle */
01637     fprintf( output, "\tBad arguments: Invalid file handle.\n" );
01638     return -1 ;
01639   }
01640 
01641     
01642   /* empty sattr3 list */
01643   if ( cmdnfs_sattr3( CMDNFS_ENCODE, 0, NULL, 0, NULL,
01644                  (caddr_t)&(arg.attributes) ) == FALSE )
01645   {
01646     /* invalid handle */
01647     fprintf( output, "\tError encoding nfs arguments.\n" );
01648     return -1 ;
01649   }
01650   
01651   /* only setting mode */
01652   arg.attributes.mode.set_it = TRUE;
01653   arg.attributes.mode.set_mode3_u.mode = posix_mode;
01654   
01655   rc = nfs_Mkdir(
01656                     (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
01657                     pexport,
01658                     &(p_thr_info->context),
01659                     &(p_thr_info->client),
01660                     ht,
01661                     &req,
01662                     (nfs_res_t*)&res
01663                  );
01664 
01665    if ( rc != 0 )
01666    {
01667      fprintf(output,"Error %d in nfs_Mkdir.\n",rc);
01668      return rc;
01669    }
01670 
01671    rc = res.status;
01672    if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01673    {
01674      fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01675          rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01676      nfs_Mkdir_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01677      return rc;
01678    }
01679 
01680   /* object handle */
01681   if ( res.MKDIR3res_u.resok.obj.handle_follows )
01682     set_shell_fh3( p_obj_hdl, &res.MKDIR3res_u.resok.obj.post_op_fh3_u.handle ) ;
01683   else
01684     fprintf(output,"Warning: nfs_Mkdir did not return file handle.\n");
01685 
01686   nfs_Mkdir_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );   
01687    
01688   return 0;
01689   
01690 } /*nfs_mkdir*/

01824                         FILE * output )

01834

01837   req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
01838 
01839   /* preparing arguments */
01840   
01841   set_nfs_fh3( &arg.object , p_obj_hdl );
01842   arg.new_attributes = *p_attributes;
01843   arg.guard.check = FALSE;
01844   
01845   /* extract export id */
01846   exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( &arg.object ) ;
01847   if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
01848   {

01851     return -1 ;

01856                     (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
01857                     pexport,
01858                     &(p_thr_info->context),
01859                     &(p_thr_info->client),
01860                     ht,
01861                     &req,
01862                     (nfs_res_t*)&res
01863                  );
01864 
01865    if ( rc != 0 )
01866    {
01867      fprintf(output,"Error %d in nfs_Setattr.\n",rc);
01868      return rc;
01869    }
01870 
01871    rc = res.status;
01872    if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01873    {
01874      fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01875          rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01876      nfs_Setattr_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01877      return rc;
01878    }
01879 
01880   nfs_Setattr_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01881   return 0;
01882   
01883 } /*nfs_setattr*/

01886 static int nfs_rename( cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info,
01887                        shell_fh3_t * p_src_dir_hdl, char * src_name,
01888                        shell_fh3_t * p_tgt_dir_hdl, char * tgt_name,
01889                        FILE * output )

01927                     ht,
01928                     &req,
01929                     (nfs_res_t*)&res

01935      return rc;
01936    }
01937 
01938    rc = res.status;
01939    if ( rc != NFS3_OK )

01944      return rc;

02018 
02019 
02020 static int nfs_symlink( cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info,
02021                        shell_fh3_t path_hdl, char * link_name,
02022                        char * link_content, sattr3 * p_setattr,
02023                        shell_fh3_t * p_link_hdl,
02024                        FILE * output )
02025 {
02026   SYMLINK3args arg;
02027   SYMLINK3res res;
02028   struct svc_req req;
02029   unsigned short exportid;
02030   exportlist_t  * pexport;
02031   int rc;
02032   
02033   /* preparing request identifier */
02034 
02035   req.rq_prog = NFS_PROGRAM;
02036   req.rq_vers = NFS_V3;      
02037   req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
02038 
02039   
02040   /* preparing arguments */
02041   
02042   set_nfs_fh3( &arg.where.dir, &path_hdl );
02043   arg.where.name = link_name;
02044   arg.symlink.symlink_attributes = *p_setattr;
02045   arg.symlink.symlink_data = link_content;
02046 
02047   exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( &arg.where.dir ) ;
02048   if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
02049   {
02050     /* invalid handle */
02051     fprintf( output, "\tBad arguments: Invalid file handle.\n" );
02052     return -1 ;
02053   }
02054 
02055     
02056   rc = nfs_Symlink(
02057                     (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
02058                     pexport,
02059                     &(p_thr_info->context),
02060                     &(p_thr_info->client),
02061                     ht,
02062                     &req,
02063                     (nfs_res_t*)&res
02064                 );
02065 
02066    if ( rc != 0 )
02067    {
02068      fprintf(output,"Error %d in nfs_Symlink.\n",rc);
02069      return rc;
02070    }
02071 
02072    rc = res.status;
02073    if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
02074    {
02075      fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
02076          rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
02077      /* free nfs call resources */
02078      nfs_Symlink_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
02079      return rc;
02080    }
02081 
02082   /* returned handle */
02083   if ( res.SYMLINK3res_u.resok.obj.handle_follows )
02084   {
02085     set_shell_fh3( p_link_hdl , &res.SYMLINK3res_u.resok.obj.post_op_fh3_u.handle ) ;
02086   }
02087   else
02088   {
02089     fprintf(output,"Warning: nfs_Symlink did not return file handle.\n");
02090   }
02091   
02092   /* free nfs call resources */
02093   nfs_Symlink_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
02094   
02095   return 0;
02096   
02097 } /*nfs_symlink*/
02098 
02099 
02100 /*------------------------------------------------------------
02101  *          High level, shell-like commands 
02102  *-----------------------------------------------------------*/
02103 
02105 int fn_nfs_mount( int argc ,          /* IN : number of args in argv */
02106                   char ** argv ,      /* IN : arg list               */
02107                   FILE * output   )   /* IN : output stream          */
02108 {
02109   nfs_arg_t nfs_arg;
02110   nfs_res_t nfs_res;
02111   struct svc_req req;
02112   int rc;
02113   char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
02114   mountres3 * p_mountres = ( mountres3 *) &nfs_res ;
02115 
02116   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
02117       
02118   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
02119   {
02120     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
02121     return -1 ;
02122   }
02123   
02124   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
02125   
02126   /* We only need to init thread in mount command. */
02127   if ( p_thr_info->is_thread_init != TRUE )
02128   {
02129     if ( rc = InitNFSClient( p_thr_info ) )
02130     {
02131       fprintf( output, "\t%s: Error %d during thread initialization.\n",argv[0],rc );
02132       return -1 ;
02133     }
02134   }
02135 
02136   /* check if a path has already been mounted */
02137   
02138   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != FALSE )
02139   {
02140     fprintf( output, "%s: a path is already mounted. Use \"umount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02141     return -1 ;
02142   }
02143   
02144       
02145   if ( cmdnfs_dirpath( CMDNFS_ENCODE,
02146                        argc - 1, argv + 1,
02147                        0, NULL,
02148                        (caddr_t)&nfs_arg ) == FALSE )
02149   {
02150     fprintf(output,"%s: bad arguments.\n",argv[0]);
02151     fprintf(output,"Usage: mount <path>.\n");
02152     return -1;
02153   }
02154     
02155   /* preparing request identifier */
02156   req.rq_prog = MOUNTPROG;
02157   req.rq_vers = MOUNT_V3;  
02158   req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
02159 
02160   /* nfs call */
02161 
02162   rc = mnt_Mnt(
02163                   &nfs_arg,
02164                   pexportlist,
02165                   &(p_thr_info->context),
02166                   &(p_thr_info->client),
02167                   ht,
02168                   &req,
02169                   &nfs_res
02170                );
02171   
02172    /* freeing args */
02173       
02174    cmdnfs_dirpath( CMDNFS_FREE,
02175                    0,NULL,0,NULL,
02176                    (caddr_t)&nfs_arg );
02177   
02178    if ( rc != 0 )
02179    {
02180      fprintf(output,"%s: Error %d in mnt_Mnt.\n",argv[0],rc);
02181      return rc;
02182    }
02183    
02184    rc = p_mountres->fhs_status;
02185    if ( rc != MNT3_OK )
02186    {
02187      mnt3_Mnt_Free( &nfs_res );
02188      fprintf(output, "%s: Error %d in MNT3 protocol.\n",argv[0],rc);
02189      return rc;
02190    }
02191    
02192    set_shell_fh3( &p_thr_info->mounted_path_hdl,
02193                   (nfs_fh3*)&p_mountres->mountres3_u.mountinfo.fhandle );
02194    
02195    mnt3_Mnt_Free( &nfs_res );
02196 
02197    strcpy( p_thr_info->mounted_path , argv[1] );
02198       
02199    p_thr_info->current_path_hdl = p_thr_info->mounted_path_hdl;
02200    strcpy( p_thr_info->current_path , "/" );
02201    
02202    p_thr_info->is_mounted_path = TRUE;
02203    
02204    fprintf( output, "Current directory is \"%s\" \n", p_thr_info->current_path ) ;
02205    snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,
02206       (caddr_t)p_thr_info->current_path_hdl.data_val ,
02207       p_thr_info->current_path_hdl.data_len ) ;
02208    fprintf( output, "Current File handle is \"@%s\" \n", buff ); 
02209   
02210   return 0;
02211 }
02212 
02213 
02214 
02216 int fn_nfs_umount( int argc ,          /* IN : number of args in argv */
02217                    char ** argv ,      /* IN : arg list               */
02218                    FILE * output   )   /* IN : output stream          */
02219 {
02220   nfs_arg_t nfs_arg;
02221   nfs_res_t nfs_res;
02222   struct svc_req req;
02223   int rc;
02224 
02225   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
02226       
02227   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
02228   {
02229     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
02230     return -1 ;
02231   }
02232   
02233   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
02234   
02235   /* We only need to init thread in mount command. */
02236   if ( p_thr_info->is_thread_init != TRUE )
02237   {
02238     if ( rc = InitNFSClient( p_thr_info ) )
02239     {
02240       fprintf( output, "\t%s: Error %d during thread initialization.\n",argv[0],rc );
02241       return -1 ;
02242     }
02243   }
02244 
02245   /* check if a path has already been mounted */
02246   
02247   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02248   {
02249     fprintf( output, "%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02250     return -1 ;
02251   }
02252   
02253       
02254   if ( cmdnfs_dirpath( CMDNFS_ENCODE,
02255                        argc - 1, argv + 1,
02256                        0, NULL,
02257                        (caddr_t)&nfs_arg ) == FALSE )
02258   {
02259     fprintf(output,"%s: bad arguments.\n",argv[0]);
02260     fprintf(output,"Usage: umount <path>.\n");
02261     return -1;
02262   }
02263 
02264   if (strncmp(argv[1], p_thr_info->mounted_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN)) {
02265     fprintf(output, "%s: this path is not mounted.\n", argv[0]);
02266     fprintf(output, "Current monted path : %s.\n", p_thr_info->mounted_path);
02267     return -1;
02268   }
02269     
02270   /* preparing request identifier */
02271   req.rq_prog = MOUNTPROG;
02272   req.rq_vers = MOUNT_V3;  
02273   req.rq_clntcred = (caddr_t) &p_thr_info->authunix_struct ;
02274 
02275   /* nfs call */
02276 
02277   rc = mnt_Umnt(
02278                   &nfs_arg,
02279                   pexportlist,
02280                   &(p_thr_info->context),
02281                   &(p_thr_info->client),
02282                   ht,
02283                   &req,
02284                   &nfs_res
02285                );
02286   
02287    /* freeing args */
02288       
02289    cmdnfs_dirpath( CMDNFS_FREE,
02290                    0,NULL,0,NULL,
02291                    (caddr_t)&nfs_arg );
02292   
02293    if ( rc != 0 )
02294    {
02295     fprintf(output,"%s: Error %d in mnt_Umnt.\n",argv[0],rc);
02296      return rc;
02297    }
02298    
02299    mnt_Umnt_Free( &nfs_res );
02300 
02301    p_thr_info->is_mounted_path = FALSE;
02302    
02303   return 0;
02304 }
02305 
02306 
02307 
02309 int fn_nfs_pwd( int argc ,          /* IN : number of args in argv */
02310                 char ** argv ,      /* IN : arg list               */
02311                 FILE * output   )   /* IN : output stream          */
02312 {
02313   char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
02314   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
02315       
02316   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
02317   {
02318     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
02319     return -1 ;
02320   }
02321   
02322   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
02323   
02324   /* check if a path has been mounted */
02325   
02326   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02327   {
02328     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02329     return -1 ;
02330   }
02331   
02332   fprintf( output, "Current directory is \"%s\" \n", p_thr_info->current_path ) ;
02333   snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,
02334       (caddr_t)p_thr_info->current_path_hdl.data_val ,
02335       p_thr_info->current_path_hdl.data_len ) ;
02336   fprintf( output, "Current File handle is \"@%s\" \n", buff ); 
02337   
02338   return 0;  
02339 }
02340 
02341 
02343 int  fn_nfs_ls( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02344                 char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02345                 FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
02346 {
02347 #define NFS_READDIR_SIZE 10
02348   
02349   char linkdata[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02350   char item_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02351   char * str_name = "." ;
02352   shell_fh3_t handle_tmp;
02353   fattr3 attrs;
02354   cookie3 begin_cookie;
02355   bool_t  eod_met;
02356   cookieverf3 cookieverf;
02357   dirlistplus3 dirlist;
02358   entryplus3 * p_entry;
02359   
02360   fattr3 * p_attrs;
02361   shell_fh3_t hdl;
02362   shell_fh3_t * p_hdl = NULL;
02363 
02364   nfs_res_t * to_free = NULL;
02365       
02366   int rc = 0 ;
02367   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02368 
02369   static char format[]="hvdlSHz";
02370   static char help_ls[]="usage: ls [options] [name|path]\n"
02371     "options :\n"
02372     "\t-h print this help\n"
02373     "\t-v verbose mode\n"
02374     "\t-d print directory info instead of listing its content\n"      
02375     "\t-l print standard UNIX attributes\n"
02376     "\t-S print all supported attributes\n"
02377     "\t-H print the NFS handle\n" 
02378     "\t-z silent mode (print nothing)\n" ;
02379   
02380   int option;
02381   int flag_v = 0;
02382   int flag_h = 0;
02383   int flag_d = 0;
02384   int flag_l = 0;
02385   int flag_S = 0;
02386   int flag_H = 0 ;
02387   int flag_z = 0 ;
02388   int err_flag = 0;
02389 
02390   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
02391       
02392   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
02393   {
02394     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
02395     return -1 ;
02396   }
02397   
02398   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
02399   
02400   /* check if a path has been mounted */
02401   
02402   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02403   {
02404     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02405     return -1 ;
02406   }
02407   
02408     
02409   /* analysing options */
02410   getopt_init();
02411 
02412   while ( (option = Getopt(argc, argv, format) ) != -1)
02413     {   
02414       switch( option )
02415         {
02416         case 'v':
02417           if (flag_v)
02418             fprintf(output,
02419                     "ls: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02420           else 
02421             flag_v++;
02422           break;
02423           
02424         case 'h':
02425           if ( flag_h )
02426             fprintf(output,
02427                     "ls: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02428           else 
02429             flag_h++;
02430           break;
02431           
02432         case 'd':
02433           if ( flag_d )
02434             fprintf(output,
02435                     "ls: warning: option 'd' has been specified more than once.\n");
02436           else 
02437             flag_d++;
02438           break;
02439           
02440         case 'l':
02441           if ( flag_l )
02442             fprintf(output,
02443                     "ls: warning: option 'l' has been specified more than once.\n");
02444           else 
02445             flag_l++;
02446           break;
02447           
02448         case 'S':
02449           if ( flag_S )
02450             fprintf(output,
02451                     "ls: warning: option 'S' has been specified more than once.\n");
02452           else 
02453             flag_S++;
02454           break;
02455           
02456         case 'z':
02457           if ( flag_z )
02458             fprintf(output,
02459                     "ls: warning: option 'z' has been specified more than once.\n");
02460           else 
02461             flag_z++;
02462           break;
02463 
02464         case 'H':
02465           if( flag_H )
02466             fprintf(output,
02467                     "ls: warning: option 'H' has been specified more than once.\n");
02468           else 
02469             flag_H++;
02470           break;
02471           
02472         case '?':
02473           fprintf(output,"ls: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02474           err_flag ++;
02475           break;
02476         }
02477     } /* while */
02478   
02479   if( flag_l + flag_S + flag_H > 1 )
02480     {
02481       fprintf(output,"ls: conflict between options l,S,H\n");
02482       err_flag++;
02483     }
02484 
02485   if( flag_z + flag_v > 1 )
02486     {
02487       fprintf( output, "ls: can't use -z and -v at the same time\n" ) ;
02488       err_flag ++ ;
02489     }
02490   
02491   if( flag_h )
02492     {
02493       fprintf(output,help_ls);
02494       return 0;
02495     }
02496   
02497   if( err_flag )
02498     {
02499       fprintf(output,help_ls);
02500       return -1;
02501     }
02502   
02503   /* copy current global path */
02504   strncpy(glob_path,p_thr_info->current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
02505 
02506   /* first, retrieve the argument (if any) */
02507   if( Optind == argc -1  )
02508     { 
02509       str_name = argv[Optind];
02510       
02511       /* retrieving handle */  
02512       if (rc = nfs_solvepath( p_thr_info,
02513                              glob_path,
02514                              NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
02515                              str_name, 
02516                              &p_thr_info->current_path_hdl, 
02517                              &handle_tmp,
02518                              output))
02519         return rc;
02520     } 
02521   else 
02522     {
02523       str_name = ".";
02524       handle_tmp = p_thr_info->current_path_hdl ;
02525     }
02526   
02527   if( flag_v )
02528     fprintf(output,"proceeding ls (using NFS protocol) on \"%s\"\n", glob_path );
02529   
02530   if ( rc = nfs_getattr( p_thr_info, &handle_tmp, &attrs, output ) ) return rc;
02531   
02532  /*
02533   * if the object is a file or a directoy with the -d option specified,
02534   * we only show its info and exit.
02535   */  
02536   if ( ( attrs.type != NF3DIR ) || flag_d )
02537     {
02538       if ( (attrs.type == NF3LNK) && flag_l )
02539         {
02540             if ( rc = nfs_readlink( p_thr_info, &handle_tmp, linkdata, output ) )
02541               return rc;
02542         }
02543       
02544       if( flag_l )
02545         {
02546           if( !flag_z )
02547             print_nfsitem_line( output, &attrs, str_name, linkdata );
02548         }
02549       else if( flag_S )
02550         {
02551           if( !flag_z )
02552             {
02553               fprintf(output,"%s :\n",str_name);
02554               print_nfs_attributes( &attrs, output );
02555             }
02556         } 
02557       else if( flag_H )
02558         {
02559           if( !flag_z )
02560             {
02561               char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1] ;
02562               
02563               snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1, (caddr_t)handle_tmp.data_val ,
02564                           handle_tmp.data_len ) ;
02565               fprintf( output, "%s (@%s)\n", str_name, buff ) ;
02566             }
02567         }
02568       else  /* only prints the name */
02569         {
02570           if( !flag_z )
02571             fprintf(output,"%s\n",str_name);
02572         }
02573         
02574       return 0;
02575     }
02576   
02577   /* If this point is reached, then the current element is a directory */
02578   
02579   begin_cookie = 0LL ;
02580   eod_met = FALSE ;
02581   memset( &cookieverf, 0, sizeof(cookieverf3) );
02582   
02583   while( ! eod_met )
02584     {
02585       
02586       if( flag_v )
02587          fprintf( output, "-->nfs3_Readdirplus( path=%s, cookie=%llu )\n",
02588                   glob_path,
02589                   begin_cookie ) ;
02590 
02591       if ( rc = nfs_readdirplus( p_thr_info,
02592                                  &handle_tmp,
02593                                  begin_cookie,
02594                                  &cookieverf, /* IN/OUT */
02595                                  &dirlist,
02596                                  &to_free,
02597                                  output ) )
02598         return rc;
02599 
02600       p_entry = dirlist.entries;
02601       
02602       
02603       while ( p_entry )
02604         {
02605           if (!strcmp(str_name,"."))
02606             strncpy(item_path,p_entry->name,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);          
02607           else if (str_name[strlen(str_name)-1] == '/')
02608             snprintf(item_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,"%s%s",str_name,p_entry->name);
02609           else
02610             snprintf(item_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,"%s/%s",str_name,p_entry->name);
02611           
02612           /* interpreting post-op attributes */
02613           
02614           if ( p_entry->name_attributes.attributes_follow )
02615             p_attrs = &p_entry->name_attributes.post_op_attr_u.attributes;
02616           else
02617             p_attrs = NULL;
02618 
02619           /* interpreting post-op handle */
02620           
02621           if ( p_entry->name_handle.handle_follows )
02622           {
02623             set_shell_fh3( &hdl, &p_entry->name_handle.post_op_fh3_u.handle );
02624             p_hdl = &hdl;
02625           }
02626           else
02627             p_hdl = NULL;
02628 
02629 
02630           if( (p_attrs != NULL)
02631                 && (p_hdl != NULL)
02632                 && (p_attrs->type == NF3LNK ) )
02633             {
02634               if ( rc = nfs_readlink( p_thr_info, p_hdl, linkdata, output ))
02635                 return rc;
02636             }
02637           
02638           if( (p_attrs != NULL) && flag_l )
02639             {
02640               print_nfsitem_line( output, p_attrs, item_path, linkdata);
02641             }
02642           else if( (p_attrs != NULL) && flag_S )
02643             {
02644               fprintf(output,"%s :\n",item_path);
02645               if( !flag_z )
02646                 print_nfs_attributes( p_attrs, output);
02647             }
02648           else if( (p_hdl != NULL) && flag_H )
02649             {
02650               if( !flag_z )
02651                 {
02652                   char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1] ;
02653 
02654                   snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1, (caddr_t)p_hdl->data_val ,
02655                               p_hdl->data_len ) ;
02656                   fprintf( output, "%s (@%s)\n", item_path, buff ) ;                  
02657                 }
02658             }
02659           else
02660             {
02661               if( !flag_z )
02662                 fprintf(output,"%s\n",item_path);
02663             }
02664             
02665           begin_cookie = p_entry->cookie ;
02666           p_entry = p_entry->nextentry;
02667         }
02668         
02669       /* Ready for next iteration */
02670       eod_met = dirlist.eof;
02671       
02672     }
02673   
02674   nfs_readdirplus_free( to_free );
02675 
02676   return 0;
02677 } /* fn_nfs_ls */
02678 
02679 
02680 
02682 int fn_nfs_cd( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02683         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02684         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02685       ){
02686 
02687   
02688   static char help_cd[]=
02689   "usage: cd <path>\n";
02690 
02691   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02692   shell_fh3_t new_hdl;
02693   int rc;
02694   fattr3 attrs;
02695   nfs3_uint32 mask;
02696     
02697   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
02698       
02699   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
02700   {
02701     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
02702     return -1 ;
02703   }
02704   
02705   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
02706   
02707   /* check if a path has been mounted */
02708   
02709   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02710   {
02711     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02712     return -1 ;
02713   }
02714   
02715   /* Exactly one arg expected */
02716   if (argc!=2){
02717     fprintf(output,help_cd);
02718     return -1;
02719   }
02720   
02721   strncpy(glob_path, p_thr_info->current_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
02722   
02723   if (rc = 
02724       nfs_solvepath( p_thr_info, glob_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
02725                      argv[1],&p_thr_info->current_path_hdl,&new_hdl,output))
02726     return rc;
02727 
02728   /* verify if the object is a directory */
02729   
02730   if ( rc = nfs_getattr( p_thr_info, &new_hdl, &attrs, output ) ) return rc;
02731   
02732   if (attrs.type != NF3DIR)
02733   {
02734     fprintf(output,"Error: %s is not a directory\n",glob_path);
02735     return ENOTDIR;
02736   }
02737   
02738   /* verify lookup permission  */  
02739   mask = ACCESS3_LOOKUP;
02740   if ( rc = nfs_access( p_thr_info, &new_hdl, &mask, output ) ) return rc;
02741   
02742   if ( ! ( mask & ACCESS3_LOOKUP ) )
02743   {
02744     fprintf(output,"Error: %s: permission denied.\n",glob_path);
02745     return EACCES;
02746   }
02747   
02748   /* if so, apply changes */
02749   strncpy( p_thr_info->current_path, glob_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );   
02750   p_thr_info->current_path_hdl = new_hdl;
02751     
02752   {
02753     char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
02754     fprintf( output, "Current directory is \"%s\" \n", p_thr_info->current_path ) ;
02755     snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,
02756         (caddr_t)p_thr_info->current_path_hdl.data_val ,
02757         p_thr_info->current_path_hdl.data_len ) ;
02758     fprintf( output, "Current File handle is \"@%s\" \n", buff ); 
02759   }
02760   
02761   return 0;
02762       
02763 }
02764 
02765 
02766 
02768 int fn_nfs_create(
02769                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02770                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02771                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02772                   )
02773 {
02774   static char format[]="hv";
02775    
02776   static char help_create[]=
02777   "usage: create [-h][-v] <path> <mode>\n"
02778   "       path: path of the file to be created\n"
02779   "       mode: octal mode for the directory to be created (ex: 644)\n" ;
02780 
02781   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02782   shell_fh3_t new_hdl ;
02783   shell_fh3_t subdir_hdl ;
02784   int rc,option;
02785   int flag_v=0;
02786   int flag_h=0;
02787   int err_flag=0;
02788   int mode = 0644;
02789   
02790   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02791   char * path;
02792   char * file;
02793   char * strmode;
02794   
02795   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
02796       
02797   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
02798   {
02799     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
02800     return -1 ;
02801   }
02802   
02803   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
02804   
02805   /* check if a path has been mounted */
02806   
02807   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02808   {
02809     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02810     return -1 ;
02811   }
02812   
02813   /* analysing options */
02814   getopt_init();
02815   while ( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1){   
02816     switch( option )
02817       {
02818       case 'v':
02819         if( flag_v )
02820           fprintf( output, "create: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02821         else flag_v++;
02822         break;
02823         
02824       case 'h':
02825         if( flag_h )
02826           fprintf( output, "create: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02827         else flag_h++;
02828         break;
02829         
02830       case '?':
02831         fprintf( output,"create: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt);
02832         err_flag ++;
02833         break;
02834     }    
02835   }
02836   
02837   if( flag_h )
02838     {
02839       fprintf( output, help_create);
02840       return 0;
02841     }
02842   
02843   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02844   if( Optind != ( argc - 2 ) )
02845     {
02846       err_flag ++;
02847     }
02848   else 
02849     {
02850       strncpy( tmp_path, argv[Optind], NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
02851       split_path( tmp_path, &path, &file);
02852       
02853       strmode = argv[Optind+1];
02854   
02855       /* converting mode string to posix mode */
02856       mode = atomode( strmode );
02857       if( mode<0 ) err_flag ++;
02858     }
02859     
02860   if( err_flag )
02861     {
02862       fprintf( output, help_create );
02863       return -1;
02864     }
02865   
02866   /* copy current path. */
02867   strncpy( glob_path, p_thr_info->current_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
02868   
02869   /* retrieves path handle*/
02870   if (rc = nfs_solvepath( p_thr_info, glob_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
02871                           path, &p_thr_info->current_path_hdl, &subdir_hdl,output) )
02872     return rc;
02873 
02874   
02875   if ( rc = nfs_create( p_thr_info, &subdir_hdl, file, mode, &new_hdl,output))
02876     return rc;
02877       
02878 
02879   if( flag_v )
02880   {
02881     char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
02882     snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,(caddr_t)new_hdl.data_val ,
02883                 new_hdl.data_len ) ;
02884     fprintf(output,"%s/%s successfully created.\n(handle=@%s)\n",glob_path,file, buff ) ;
02885   }
02886 
02887   return 0;  
02888 
02889 
02890 }
02891
