02893 
02895 int fn_nfs_mkdir(
02896                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02897                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02898                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02899                   )
02900 {
02901   static char format[]="hv";
02902    
02903   static char help_mkdir[]=
02904   "usage: mkdir [-h][-v] <path> <mode>\n"
02905   "       path: path of the directory to be created\n"
02906   "       mode: octal mode for the dir to be created (ex: 755)\n" ;
02907 
02908   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02909   shell_fh3_t new_hdl ;
02910   shell_fh3_t subdir_hdl ;
02911   int rc,option;
02912   int flag_v=0;
02913   int flag_h=0;
02914   int err_flag=0;
02915   int mode = 0755;
02916   
02917   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02918   char * path;
02919   char * file;
02920   char * strmode;
02921   
02922   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
02923       
02924   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
02925   {
02926     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
02927     return -1 ;
02928   }
02929   
02930   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
02931   
02932   /* check if a path has been mounted */
02933   
02934   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02935   {
02936     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02937     return -1 ;
02938   }
02939   
02940   /* analysing options */
02941   getopt_init();
02942   while ( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1){   
02943     switch( option )
02944       {
02945       case 'v':
02946         if( flag_v )
02947           fprintf( output, "mkdir: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02948         else flag_v++;
02949         break;
02950         
02951       case 'h':
02952         if( flag_h )
02953           fprintf( output, "mkdir: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02954         else flag_h++;
02955         break;
02956         
02957       case '?':
02958         fprintf( output,"mkdir: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt);
02959         err_flag ++;
02960         break;
02961     }    
02962   }
02963   
02964   if( flag_h )
02965     {
02966       fprintf( output, help_mkdir);
02967       return 0;
02968     }
02969   
02970   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02971   if( Optind != ( argc - 2 ) )
02972     {
02973       err_flag ++;
02974     }
02975   else 
02976     {
02977       strncpy( tmp_path, argv[Optind], NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
02978       split_path( tmp_path, &path, &file);
02979       
02980       strmode = argv[Optind+1];
02981   
02982       /* converting mode string to posix mode */
02983       mode = atomode( strmode );
02984       if( mode<0 ) err_flag ++;
02985     }
02986     
02987   if( err_flag )
02988     {
02989       fprintf( output, help_mkdir );
02990       return -1;
02991     }
02992   
02993   /* copy current path. */
02994   strncpy( glob_path, p_thr_info->current_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
02995   
02996   /* retrieves path handle*/
02997   if (rc = nfs_solvepath( p_thr_info, glob_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
02998                           path, &p_thr_info->current_path_hdl, &subdir_hdl,output) )
02999     return rc;
03000 
03001   
03002   if ( rc = nfs_mkdir( p_thr_info, &subdir_hdl, file, mode, &new_hdl,output))
03003     return rc;
03004       
03005 
03006   if( flag_v )
03007   {
03008     char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
03009     snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,(caddr_t)new_hdl.data_val ,
03010                 new_hdl.data_len ) ;
03011     fprintf(output,"%s/%s successfully created.\n(handle=@%s)\n",glob_path,file, buff ) ;
03012   }
03013 
03014   return 0;  
03015 
03016 
03017 }
03018 
03019 
03021 int fn_nfs_unlink(
03022                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03023                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03024                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
03025                   )
03026 {
03027   static char format[]="hv";
03028    
03029   static char help_unlink[]=
03030   "usage: unlink [-h][-v] <path>\n"
03031   "       path: path of the directory to be unlinkd\n";
03032   
03033   char glob_path_parent[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03034   char glob_path_object[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03035   shell_fh3_t subdir_hdl ;
03036   shell_fh3_t obj_hdl ; 
03037   fattr3 attrs; 
03038   int rc,option;
03039   int flag_v=0;
03040   int flag_h=0;
03041   int err_flag=0;
03042   
03043   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03044   char * path;
03045   char * file;
03046   
03047   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
03048       
03049   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
03050   {
03051     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
03052     return -1 ;
03053   }
03054   
03055   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
03056   
03057   /* check if a path has been mounted */
03058   
03059   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
03060   {
03061     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
03062     return -1 ;
03063   }
03064   
03065   /* analysing options */
03066   getopt_init();
03067   while ( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1){   
03068     switch( option )
03069       {
03070       case 'v':
03071         if( flag_v )
03072           fprintf( output, "unlink: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03073         else flag_v++;
03074         break;
03075         
03076       case 'h':
03077         if( flag_h )
03078           fprintf( output, "unlink: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03079         else flag_h++;
03080         break;
03081         
03082       case '?':
03083         fprintf( output,"unlink: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt);
03084         err_flag ++;
03085         break;
03086     }    
03087   }
03088   
03089   if( flag_h )
03090     {
03091       fprintf( output, help_unlink);
03092       return 0;
03093     }
03094   
03095   /* Exactly 1 args expected */
03096   if( Optind != ( argc - 1 ) )
03097     {
03098       err_flag ++;
03099     }
03100   else 
03101     {
03102       strncpy( tmp_path, argv[Optind], NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
03103       split_path( tmp_path, &path, &file);      
03104     }
03105   
03106   /* copy current path. */
03107   strncpy( glob_path_parent, p_thr_info->current_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
03108   
03109   /* retrieves parent dir handle*/
03110   if (rc = nfs_solvepath( p_thr_info, glob_path_parent, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03111                           path, &p_thr_info->current_path_hdl, &subdir_hdl,output) )
03112     return rc;
03113 
03114    /* copy parent path */
03115    strncpy( glob_path_object, glob_path_parent, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
03116    
03117    /* lookup on child object */
03118    if (rc = nfs_solvepath( p_thr_info, glob_path_object, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03119                           file, &subdir_hdl, &obj_hdl, output) )
03120     return rc;
03121     
03122    /* get attributes of child object */
03123    if( flag_v )
03124       fprintf(output,"Getting attributes for %s...\n",glob_path_object );
03125 
03126    if ( rc = nfs_getattr( p_thr_info, &obj_hdl, &attrs, output ) ) return rc;
03127 
03128     if ( attrs.type != NF3DIR )
03129     {
03130       if( flag_v )
03131         fprintf(output,"%s is not a directory: calling nfs3_remove...\n",glob_path_object );
03132       
03133       if ( rc = nfs_remove( p_thr_info, &subdir_hdl, file, output))
03134         return rc;
03135     }
03136     else
03137     {
03138       if( flag_v )
03139         fprintf(output,"%s is a directory: calling nfs3_rmdir...\n",glob_path_object );
03140       
03141       if ( rc = nfs_rmdir( p_thr_info, &subdir_hdl, file, output))
03142         return rc;     
03143     }  
03144 
03145   if( flag_v )
03146     fprintf(output,"%s successfully removed.\n",glob_path_object );
03147 
03148   return 0;
03149 
03150 }
03151 
03153 int fn_nfs_setattr( int     argc ,     /* IN : number of args in argv */
03154                             char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03155                             FILE *  output     /* IN : output stream          */ )
03156 {
03157   
03158   static char format[]="hv";
03159    
03160   static char help_setattr[]=
03161     "usage: setattr [-h][-v] <path> <attr>=<value>,<attr>=<value>,...\n"
03162     "       where <attr> can be :\n"
03163     "          mode(octal value),\n"
03164     "          uid, gid, (unsigned 32 bits integer)\n"
03165     "          size, (unsigned  64 bits integer)\n"
03166     "          atime, mtime (format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.nnnnnnnnn)\n";
03167 
03168   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
03169 
03170   shell_fh3_t obj_hdl ;        /* handle of the object    */
03171   sattr3  set_attrs;       /* attributes to be setted */
03172   char * attr_string;
03173   
03174   int rc, option;
03175   int flag_v=0;
03176   int flag_h=0;
03177   int err_flag=0;
03178   
03179   char file[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN]; /* the relative path to the object */
03180        
03181   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
03182       
03183   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
03184   {
03185     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
03186     return -1 ;
03187   }
03188   
03189   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
03190   
03191   /* check if a path has been mounted */
03192   
03193   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
03194   {
03195     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
03196     return -1 ;
03197   }
03198     
03199   /* analysing options */
03200   getopt_init() ;
03201   
03202   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format )) != -1 )
03203   {   
03204     switch( option )
03205       {
03206       case 'v':
03207         if( flag_v )
03208           fprintf( output, "setattr: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03209         else 
03210           flag_v++;
03211         break;
03212         
03213       case 'h':
03214         if( flag_h )
03215           fprintf(output, "setattr: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03216         else 
03217           flag_h++;
03218         break;
03219         
03220       case '?':
03221         fprintf(output,"setattr: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03222         err_flag ++;
03223         break;
03224     }    
03225   }
03226   
03227   if( flag_h )
03228     {
03229       /* print usage */
03230       fprintf(output,help_setattr);
03231       return 0;
03232     }
03233   
03234   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
03235   
03236   if( Optind != ( argc - 2 ) )
03237     {
03238       err_flag ++;
03239     } 
03240   else 
03241     {
03242       strcpy( file,  argv[Optind] ) ;
03243       attr_string = argv[Optind+1]; 
03244     }
03245   
03246   if( err_flag )
03247     {
03248       fprintf( output, help_setattr );
03249       return -1;
03250     }
03251   
03252   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
03253   strncpy( glob_path, p_thr_info->current_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03254   
03255   /* retrieve handle to the file whose attributes are to be changed */
03256   if( rc = nfs_solvepath( p_thr_info, glob_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN, file, &p_thr_info->current_path_hdl, &obj_hdl, output ) )
03257     return rc ;
03258     
03259   /* Convert the peer (attr_name,attr_val) to an sattr3 structure. */
03260   if ( cmdnfs_sattr3( CMDNFS_ENCODE,
03261                            1, &attr_string, 0, NULL, (caddr_t)&set_attrs ) 
03262       == FALSE )
03263   {
03264     fprintf( output, "Invalid nfs arguments.\n" );
03265     fprintf( output, help_setattr );
03266     return -1;
03267   }
03268                               
03269   /* executes set attrs */
03270   if ( rc = nfs_setattr( p_thr_info, &obj_hdl, &set_attrs, output ) ) return rc;
03271 
03272   if (flag_v)
03273     fprintf(output,"Attributes of \"%s\" successfully changed.\n",glob_path );
03274         
03275   return 0;  
03276 } /* fn_nfs_setattr */
03277 
03278 
03279 
03281 int fn_nfs_rename( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03282         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03283         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
03284       ){
03285   
03286   
03287   static char format[]="hv";
03288    
03289   static char help_rename[]=
03290   "usage: rename [-h][-v] <src> <dest>\n";
03291 
03292   char src_glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03293   char tgt_glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03294   
03295   shell_fh3_t src_path_handle, tgt_path_handle;
03296   
03297   int rc,option;
03298   int flag_v=0;
03299   int flag_h=0;
03300   int err_flag=0;
03301   
03302   char tmp_path1[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03303   char tmp_path2[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03304   char * src_path;
03305   char * src_file;
03306   char * tgt_path;
03307   char * tgt_file;
03308       
03309   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
03310       
03311   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
03312   {
03313     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
03314     return -1 ;
03315   }
03316   
03317   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
03318   
03319   /* check if a path has been mounted */
03320   
03321   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
03322   {
03323     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
03324     return -1 ;
03325   }
03326   
03327   /* analysing options */
03328   getopt_init();
03329   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
03330     switch(option){
03331       case 'v':
03332         if (flag_v)
03333           fprintf(output,
03334               "rename: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03335         else flag_v++;
03336         break;
03337       case 'h':
03338         if ( flag_h )
03339           fprintf(output,
03340               "rename: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03341         else flag_h++;
03342         break;
03343       case '?':
03344         fprintf(output,"rename: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03345         err_flag ++;
03346         break;
03347     }    
03348   }
03349   
03350   if (flag_h){
03351     fprintf(output,help_rename);
03352     return 0;
03353   }
03354   
03355   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
03356   if (Optind != (argc-2)){
03357     err_flag ++;
03358   } else {
03359     
03360     strncpy(tmp_path1,argv[Optind],NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03361     split_path(tmp_path1,&src_path,&src_file);
03362 
03363     strncpy(tmp_path2,argv[Optind+1],NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03364     split_path(tmp_path2,&tgt_path,&tgt_file);
03365     
03366   }
03367   
03368   if (err_flag){
03369     fprintf(output,help_rename);
03370     return -1;
03371   }
03372   
03373   if (flag_v)
03374     fprintf(output,"Renaming %s (dir %s) to %s (dir %s)\n",
03375         src_file,src_path,tgt_file,tgt_path);
03376   
03377   /* copy current path. */
03378   strncpy(src_glob_path,p_thr_info->current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03379   strncpy(tgt_glob_path,p_thr_info->current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03380   
03381   /* retrieves paths handles */
03382   if (rc = 
03383       nfs_solvepath(p_thr_info, src_glob_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03384                 src_path, &p_thr_info->current_path_hdl,&src_path_handle,output))
03385     return rc;
03386 
03387   if (rc = 
03388       nfs_solvepath(p_thr_info, tgt_glob_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03389                 tgt_path, &p_thr_info->current_path_hdl,&tgt_path_handle,output))
03390     return rc;
03391 
03392   
03393   /* Rename operation */  
03394   
03395   if ( rc = nfs_rename(
03396     p_thr_info,
03397     &src_path_handle,      /* IN */
03398     src_file,             /* IN */
03399     &tgt_path_handle,      /* IN */
03400     tgt_file,             /* IN */
03401     output ) ) return rc;
03402   
03403 
03404   if (flag_v)
03405     fprintf( output,"%s/%s successfully renamed to %s/%s\n",
03406           src_glob_path, src_file,
03407           tgt_glob_path, tgt_file
03408         );
03409 
03410   return 0;
03411   
03412 }
03413 
03414 
03415 
03416 
03418 int fn_nfs_hardlink( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03419         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03420         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
03421       ){
03422   
03423   
03424   static char format[]="hv";
03425    
03426   static char help_hardlink[]=
03427   "hardlink: create a hard link.\n"
03428   "usage: hardlink [-h][-v] <target> <new_path>\n"
03429   "       target: path of an existing file.\n"
03430   "       new_path: path of the hardlink to be created\n";
03431 
03432   char glob_path_target[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03433   char glob_path_link[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03434   
03435   shell_fh3_t target_hdl, dir_hdl;
03436   
03437   int rc,option;
03438   int flag_v=0;
03439   int flag_h=0;
03440   int err_flag=0;
03441   
03442   char * target = NULL;
03443   
03444   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03445   char * path;
03446   char * name;
03447       
03448   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
03449       
03450   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
03451   {
03452     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
03453     return -1 ;
03454   }
03455   
03456   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
03457   
03458   /* check if a path has been mounted */
03459   
03460   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
03461   {
03462     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
03463     return -1 ;
03464   }
03465   
03466   /* analysing options */
03467   getopt_init();
03468   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
03469     switch(option){
03470       case 'v':
03471         if (flag_v)
03472           fprintf(output,
03473               "hardlink: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03474         else flag_v++;
03475         break;
03476       case 'h':
03477         if ( flag_h )
03478           fprintf(output,
03479               "hardlink: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03480         else flag_h++;
03481         break;
03482       case '?':
03483         fprintf(output,"hardlink: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03484         err_flag ++;
03485         break;
03486     }    
03487   }
03488   
03489   if (flag_h){
03490     fprintf(output,help_hardlink);
03491     return 0;
03492   }
03493   
03494   /* 2 args expected */
03495   
03496   if ( Optind == (argc-2) ){
03497     
03498     target = argv[Optind];
03499     
03500     strncpy(tmp_path,argv[Optind+1],NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03501     split_path(tmp_path,&path,&name);
03502 
03503   } else {    
03504     err_flag ++;    
03505   }
03506   
03507   
03508   if (err_flag){
03509     fprintf(output,help_hardlink);
03510     return -1;
03511   }
03512     
03513   /* copy current path. */
03514   strncpy(glob_path_target,p_thr_info->current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03515   strncpy(glob_path_link,p_thr_info->current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03516   
03517   /* retrieves path handle for target */
03518   if (rc = 
03519       nfs_solvepath(p_thr_info, glob_path_target,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03520                 target,&p_thr_info->current_path_hdl,&target_hdl,output))
03521     return rc;
03522 
03523   /* retrieves path handle for parent dir */
03524   if (rc = 
03525       nfs_solvepath(p_thr_info, glob_path_link,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03526                 path,&p_thr_info->current_path_hdl,&dir_hdl,output))
03527     return rc;
03528   
03529   
03530 
03531   rc = nfs_link(
03532           p_thr_info,
03533           &target_hdl,   /* IN - target file */
03534           &dir_hdl,      /* IN - parent dir handle */
03535           name,         /* IN - link name */
03536           output );     /* OUT - new attributes */
03537   
03538   if ( rc ) return rc;
03539 
03540   if (flag_v)
03541     fprintf(output,"%s/%s <=> %s successfully created\n",path,name,glob_path_target);
03542       
03543   return 0;
03544   
03545 }
03546 
03547 
03548 
03551 int fn_nfs_ln( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03552         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03553         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
03554       ){
03555   
03556   
03557   static char format[]="hv";
03558    
03559   static char help_ln[]=
03560   "ln: create a symbolic link.\n"
03561   "usage: ln [-h][-v] <link_content> <link_path>\n"
03562   "       link_content: content of the symbolic link to be created\n"
03563   "       link_path: path of the symbolic link to be created\n";
03564 
03565   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03566   shell_fh3_t path_hdl,link_hdl;
03567   sattr3 set_attrs;
03568   int rc,option;
03569   int flag_v=0;
03570   int flag_h=0;
03571   int err_flag=0;
03572   
03573   char * content = NULL;
03574   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03575   char * path;
03576   char * name;
03577     
03578   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
03579       
03580   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
03581   {
03582     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
03583     return -1 ;
03584   }
03585   
03586   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
03587   
03588   /* check if a path has been mounted */
03589   
03590   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
03591   {
03592     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
03593     return -1 ;
03594   }
03595   
03596   /* analysing options */
03597   getopt_init();
03598   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
03599     switch(option){
03600       case 'v':
03601         if (flag_v)
03602           fprintf(output,
03603               "ln: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03604         else flag_v++;
03605         break;
03606       case 'h':
03607         if ( flag_h )
03608           fprintf(output,
03609               "ln: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03610         else flag_h++;
03611         break;
03612       case '?':
03613         fprintf(output,"ln: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03614         err_flag ++;
03615         break;
03616     }    
03617   }
03618   
03619   if (flag_h){
03620     fprintf(output,help_ln);
03621     return 0;
03622   }
03623   
03624   /* 2 args expected */
03625   
03626   if ( Optind == (argc-2) ){
03627     
03628     content = argv[Optind];
03629     
03630     strncpy(tmp_path,argv[Optind+1],NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03631     split_path(tmp_path,&path,&name);
03632 
03633   } else {
03634     err_flag ++;
03635   }
03636   
03637   
03638   if (err_flag){
03639     fprintf(output,help_ln);
03640     return -1;
03641   }
03642     
03643   /* copy current path. */
03644   strncpy(glob_path,p_thr_info->current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03645   
03646   /* retrieves path handle*/
03647   if (rc = 
03648       nfs_solvepath( p_thr_info, glob_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03649                      path,&p_thr_info->current_path_hdl,&path_hdl,output))
03650     return rc;
03651 
03652   
03653   /* Prepare link attributes : empty sattr3 list */
03654   
03655   if ( cmdnfs_sattr3( CMDNFS_ENCODE, 0, NULL, 0, NULL,
03656                  (caddr_t)&set_attrs ) == FALSE )
03657   {
03658     /* invalid handle */
03659     fprintf( output, "\tError encoding nfs arguments.\n" );
03660     return -1 ;
03661   }
03662   
03663   
03664 
03665   rc = nfs_symlink(
03666           p_thr_info,
03667           path_hdl,  /* IN - parent dir handle */
03668           name,      /* IN - link name */
03669           content,   /* IN - link content */
03670           &set_attrs, /* Link attributes */
03671           &link_hdl,  /* OUT - link handle*/
03672           output );
03673   
03674   if (rc) return rc;
03675   
03676   if (flag_v)
03677   {
03678     char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
03679     snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,(caddr_t)link_hdl.data_val ,
03680                 link_hdl.data_len );
03681   
03682     fprintf(output,"%s/%s -> %s successfully created (@%s) \n",path,name,content,buff);
03683   }
03684       
03685   return 0;  
03686 }

03690 
03692 int  fn_nfs_stat( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03693                 char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03694                 FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
03695 {
03696   
03697   shell_fh3_t handle_tmp;
03698   fattr3 attrs;
03699   
03700   int rc = 0 ;
03701   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03702 
03703   static char format[]="hvHz";
03704   static char help_stat[]="usage: stat [options] <path>\n"
03705     "options :\n"
03706     "\t-h print this help\n"
03707     "\t-v verbose mode\n"
03708     "\t-H print the NFS handle\n" 
03709     "\t-z silent mode (print nothing)\n" ;
03710   
03711   int option;
03712   char * str_name = NULL;
03713   int flag_v = 0;
03714   int flag_h = 0;
03715   int flag_H = 0 ;
03716   int flag_z = 0 ;
03717   int err_flag = 0;
03718 
03719   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
03720       
03721   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
03722   {
03723     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
03724     return -1 ;
03725   }
03726   
03727   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
03728   
03729   /* check if a path has been mounted */
03730   
03731   if ( p_thr_info->is_mounted_path != TRUE )
03732   {
03733     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
03734     return -1 ;
03735   }
03736   
03737     
03738   /* analysing options */
03739   getopt_init();
03740 
03741   while ( (option = Getopt(argc, argv, format) ) != -1)
03742     {   
03743       switch( option )
03744         {
03745         case 'v':
03746           if (flag_v)
03747             fprintf(output,
03748                     "stat: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03749           else 
03750             flag_v++;
03751           break;
03752           
03753         case 'h':
03754           if ( flag_h )
03755             fprintf(output,
03756                     "stat: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03757           else 
03758             flag_h++;
03759           break;
03760           
03761         case 'z':
03762           if ( flag_z )
03763             fprintf(output,
03764                     "stat: warning: option 'z' has been specified more than once.\n");
03765           else 
03766             flag_z++;
03767           break;
03768 
03769         case 'H':
03770           if( flag_H )
03771             fprintf(output,
03772                     "stat: warning: option 'H' has been specified more than once.\n");
03773           else 
03774             flag_H++;
03775           break;
03776           
03777         case '?':
03778           fprintf(output,"stat: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03779           err_flag ++;
03780           break;
03781         }
03782     } /* while */
03783   
03784   if( flag_z + flag_v > 1 )
03785     {
03786       fprintf( output, "stat: can't use -z and -v at the same time\n" ) ;
03787       err_flag ++ ;
03788     }
03789   
03790   if( flag_h )
03791     {
03792       fprintf(output,help_stat);
03793       return 0;
03794     }
03795     
03796   if( Optind != argc -1 )
03797     {
03798       fprintf( output, "stat: Missing argument: <path>\n" ) ;
03799       err_flag ++;
03800     }
03801   else
03802    {
03803      str_name = argv[Optind];
03804    }
03805   
03806   if( err_flag )
03807     {
03808       fprintf(output,help_stat);
03809       return -1;
03810     }
03811   
03812   /* copy current global path */
03813   strncpy(glob_path,p_thr_info->current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03814 
03815   /* retrieving handle */
03816   if (rc = nfs_solvepath( p_thr_info,
03817                          glob_path,
03818                          NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03819                          str_name, 
03820                          &p_thr_info->current_path_hdl, 
03821                          &handle_tmp,
03822                          output))
03823     return rc;
03824   
03825   if( flag_v )
03826     fprintf(output,"proceeding stat (using NFS protocol) on \"%s\"\n", glob_path );
03827   
03828   if ( rc = nfs_getattr( p_thr_info, &handle_tmp, &attrs, output ) ) return rc;
03829   
03830   if ( flag_H )
03831   {
03832     if( !flag_z )
03833       {
03834         char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1] ;
03835 
03836         snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1, (caddr_t)handle_tmp.data_val ,
03837                     handle_tmp.data_len ) ;
03838         fprintf( output, "%s (@%s)\n", str_name, buff ) ;
03839       }
03840   }
03841   else if( !flag_z )
03842   {
03843     /*fprintf(output,"%s :\n",str_name);*/
03844     print_nfs_attributes( &attrs, output );
03845   }
03846   
03847   return 0;
03848 } /* fn_nfs_stat */

03851 
03852 
03854 int fn_nfs_su( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03855                char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03856                FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
03857 {
03858   int rc, i;
03859   char * str_uid;
03860   uid_t uid;
03861   fsal_status_t st;
03862   struct passwd * pw_struct;
03863   
03864 #define MAX_GRPS  128
03865   gid_t   groups_tab[MAX_GRPS];
03866   int     nb_grp;
03867 
03868   static char help_su[]=
03869   "usage: su <uid>\n";
03870 
03871   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
03872       
03873   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
03874   {
03875     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
03876     return -1 ;
03877   }
03878   
03879   /* UID arg expected */
03880   if ( argc != 2 )
03881   {
03882     fprintf(output,help_su);
03883     return -1;
03884   }
03885   else
03886   {
03887     str_uid = argv[1];
03888   }
03889 
03890   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
03891   
03892   if ( p_thr_info->is_thread_init != TRUE )
03893   {
03894     if ( rc = InitNFSClient( p_thr_info ) )
03895     {
03896       fprintf( output, "\t%s: Error %d during thread initialization.\n",argv[0],rc );
03897       return -1 ;
03898     }
03899   }
03900   
03901   
03902   if ( isdigit( str_uid[0] ) )
03903   {
03904     if ( (uid = my_atoi(str_uid) ) == (uid_t)-1 )
03905     {
03906       fprintf(output,"Error: invalid uid \"%s\"\n",str_uid);
03907       return -1;
03908     }
03909     pw_struct = getpwuid(uid); 
03910   }
03911   else
03912   {
03913     pw_struct = getpwnam( str_uid );
03914   }
03915   
03916   if ( pw_struct == NULL )
03917   {
03918     fprintf( output, "Unknown user %s\n", str_uid );
03919     return errno;
03920   }
03921   
03922   nb_grp = getugroups( MAX_GRPS, groups_tab, pw_struct->pw_name, pw_struct->pw_gid );
03923   
03924   fprintf( output, "Changing user to : %s ( uid = %d, gid = %d )\n",
03925        pw_struct->pw_name , pw_struct->pw_uid, pw_struct->pw_gid );
03926   
03927   if ( nb_grp > 1 )
03928   {
03929     fprintf( output, "altgroups = ");
03930     for ( i = 1; i < nb_grp; i++ )
03931     {      
03932       if ( i == 1 )
03933         fprintf( output, "%d", groups_tab[i]);
03934       else
03935         fprintf( output, ", %d", groups_tab[i]);      
03936     }
03937     fprintf( output, "\n");
03938   }
03939 
03940   st = FSAL_GetClientContext( &p_thr_info->context, &p_thr_info->exp_context,
03941                               pw_struct->pw_uid, pw_struct->pw_gid, groups_tab, nb_grp );
03942       
03943   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) )
03944   {
03945     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_GetUserCred:");
03946     print_fsal_status(output,st);
03947     fprintf(output,"\n");
03948     return st.major;
03949   }
03950   
03951   fprintf(output,"Done.\n");
03952   
03953   return 0;
03954   
03955 }
03956 
03957 
03958 int fn_nfs_id( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03959                       char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03960                       FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
03961 {
03962   int rc;
03963   cmdnfs_thr_info_t * p_thr_info = NULL;
03964       
03965   if ( is_nfs_layer_initialized != TRUE )
03966   {
03967     fprintf( output, "\tNFS layer not initialized.\n" );
03968     return -1 ;
03969   }
03970   
03971   p_thr_info = GetNFSClient();
03972   
03973   if ( p_thr_info->is_thread_init != TRUE )
03974   {
03975     if ( rc = InitNFSClient( p_thr_info ) )
03976     {
03977       fprintf( output, "\t%s: Error %d during thread initialization.\n",argv[0],rc );
03978       return -1 ;
03979     }
03980   }
03981   
03982 #ifdef _USE_POSIX
03983   fprintf(output, "Current user : uid = %d, gid = %d\n",
03984        p_thr_info->context.credential.user, p_thr_info->context.credential.group);
03985 #endif
03986 
03987   return 0;
03988 }
